snippet: If Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 flew north over the Asian mainland, it would have had a hard time avoiding detection by Chinese, Indian or American radar, current and ex-military officers say.
abstract: Current and former military officers say missing Malaysia Airlines jet would very likely have been detected by Chinese, Indian or American radar if it flew north over Asian mainland after losing contact with ground controllers; assertion may narrow possible routes that plane could have taken after disappearing.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Gardiner Harris and Suhasini Raj from New Delhi, Jonathan Ansfield from Beijing, and Thomas Fuller and Poypiti Amatatham from Bangkok.

lead_paragraph: If Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 flew north over the Asian mainland, it would have had a hard time avoiding detection by Chinese, Indian or American radar, current and ex-military officers say.

headline.main: Radar on Mainland Too Robust to Miss a Jet, Experts Say
headline.print_headline: Experts See Robust Radar Along Jet’s Potential Path
